Reviews.Title: “Decent room,bad Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: mooker624
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Wyndham Garden in Oklahoma City, and loved it.Both are rated 3 star. I was expecting the same when I was booked here by Hotwire. No such luck.First, the Wi-Fi never worked properly the 3 days we stayed.The fan in the bathroom was too loud. The door was not sealed well, letting in light from the parking lot.Same for the curtains.On the positive side,the room was clean, the beds were comfortable, free parking, and many dining options nearby.I would rate it a 2.5 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I recently went to San Diego to attend a concert at the San Diego Sports Arena. Check in was fast. Room was clean and well kept. Wyndham Garden hotel was right across the street from the Sports Arena!! We conveniently just walked across the street to our event.

Reviews.Title: “Economical”
Reviews.Author: Dustytexas
Reviews.Content: It was a good location for what we needed. It was a little hard to find at first. Even though it is on a major street, the sign was difficult to see. The staff were friendly and the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not for luxery but good for economy”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: This motel is conveniently located and clean, but not posh by any standard. Our room was street facing and there are a lot of sirens all night, so also not good if you are a light sleeper. Staff was freindly and responsive. Small issues with television not working properly and poor electrical sockets that don't hold the plugs in, but otherwise okay. The price was reasonable for the area. It is in an industrial area however one of our favorite restaurants is directly across the street (Phil's BBQ). The SPorts Arena is also across the street so on flea market day there can be some unwanted foot traffic. Close to Sea World and Mission Beach. Had to chase off some kids who were squatting in front of our door to smoke and the smoke was coming straight into our room. This is a popular hotel for college kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good family location”
Reviews.Author: VegasTraveler105
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the kids suites, 3/15/12-3/21/12. The room was great for families with children. Roomy enough to be comfortable. The microwave and fridge were a great feature. The staff was very accommodating and pleasant. There are plenty of food options within walking distance, but it was cold and rainy for most of our stay so we used the car. Close to all of the area attractions and convenient to all major highways. The only down sides were that the free Wi-Fi does not work at all. When we called the front desk to inquire, they suggested we come to the lobby for a better signal, but the signal just outside the lobby door was no better than in the room. I would suggest they don't advertise free wi-fi. They really don't have it. The second issue we had was a homeless man who wanted to discuss his search for a wife with my son-in-law and my husband. They were able to get him to move on without incident, but it frightened the children a bit. Overall the motel was great for our purposes and the kids had a good time. If it hadn't been rainy, I'm sure the kids would have used the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Old But Close to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: Sue A
Reviews.Content: Reservations were incorrect, and staff tried to blame it on Hotwire. Finally understood that we had followed up the Hotwire reservation with a call to this property to be sure we could have a King bed. They placed us in a "junior suite," so named I guess because it has bunk beds and a frig. Found human hairs in the bathtub and bathroom floor; had it re-cleaned while we left for dinner. There has been a disabled truck and "hauling business" trailer, as well as a 70's model trashed motor home parked on the street where you enter the property, which is placed between a "psychic reader" and a Home Depot -- not the best of relaxing locales but it IS a really close and easy drive to SeaWorld from here.

Reviews.Title: “Safe enough for my sister to stay here w/ kids!”
Reviews.Author: Kesia W
Reviews.Content: My sister came to bring the kids to Sea World from Northern California and Wyndham Garden upgraded them into a mini suite with bunk beds. The location was perfect for them since Sea World is close and Chucky Cheese is less than 1/2 mile! Plus I bought them a fresh baked pie from Dupars...(see photo)! I was able to take them to the hot spots in Pt. Loma like Pt. Loma Seafood, Cabrillo National Monument and Mission Bay to ride the roller coasters. THey want to definately come back to visit their Auntie in San Diego :)

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE experience + Drug Paraphernalia found in room”
Reviews.Author: Danica R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 year old stayed here for 2 days while on vacation and we regret ever checking into this place. From looking at the pictures on their website, we thought we were getting a great deal. The pictures made that place look so luxurious and it's not whatsoever. It's way overpriced and they don't even have a free continental breakfast. You have to buy it from a bakery in the parking lot. Also our room keys quit working each day and it wasn't due to having them near our phones because I made sure to keep them in a separate pocket. You will also hear the police sirens about 3 times a night. But the worst part was when my 2 year old found a bottle of marijuana under the bed. We called the front desk and the assistant manager was rude. All she did was offer free breakfast! After giving them negative feedback on their survey, the main manager called and told me she would pay for 1 night there if we ever went back. That will never happen.

Reviews.Title: “I expected much more from the Wyndham Brand”
Reviews.Author: Phar2003
Reviews.Content: This property is VERY OLD, not that age is unusual in hotel properties, but this one looks old and is in what looks like a questionable neighborhood. The room we has was in what appeared to be mid renovation, even though the front desk staff assured me the renovations were complete. The room appeared to be clean until I started to look more closely, then, not so much. The sink and mirrors are in the same room with the bed. The OLD (age wise) shower/tub and toilet are in a VERY SMALL room which has a door which will not open fully because the WORLDS HARDEST MATTRESS on the king sized bed is in the way. Very disappointing in most every way and VERY OVERPRICED for the quality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight close to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: mac52ct
Reviews.Content: Convenient to the airport for an early morning flight. Good value. Room was clean and they have a 24 hour restaurant. Outdoor pool and spa. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: carynoon
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3:30 (check in at 3) and there were no rooms ready. We waited about an hour and came back....there were no parking spaces! We were told we could park in a handicap space (no way!) We ended up parking about a block from our room. There seemed to be a lot of "underage" people congregated in the parking lot. The room was clean but no blanket on the bed, no wash cloths or bath mat. You could hear the people in the room upstairs. It is close to shopping, restaurants and Old Town. Probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, enjoyed stay.”
Reviews.Author: zasha_4723
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was greeted by sara she was very friendly and her energy was nice after a long drive , she checked my husband and I in all while dealing with our daughter who kept asking questions. I was given a quick tour on a map and suggested 3rd floor because of a full house which I wouldn't have thought of. We went to our room and found that our remote wasn't working called down to get it fixed and it was. I didn't have any towels in our room at all and had to call down for that too. I don't understand why there wasn't any but Sara once again sent them quickly to fix it and was apologetic Had there not been great customer service I would not have left a review. I will stay here again as the room was clean with just minor problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: C L R
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding and had an overall good time here.... we didnt spend much time in the room but for the most part it was nice.... the front desk attendant appropriated us with an upgraded room for no extra charge and was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old but for $67 a night for 5 people it is good value. Rooms are on the small side and a bit of a squeaze for 5 people. The first room we got the AC was not working but staff where friendly and shifted us to a better room. Great restuarants and supermarkets near by and close to Seaworld and short drive to Legoland, Zoo and San Diego. Plenty of free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Love San Diego”
Reviews.Author: happy_mexico
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the beautiful city of San Diego in October 2011 Loved the city and the people. Being from Canada the weather was great for us. The locals had jackets on. I was fine with a light hoody at night. Old town was by far the best for us. As a couple in our late 30's we did not hit up all the amusement parks. We did go to sea world tip look to see if your hotel has deals it's cheaper that way. Our hotel was nice enough. Our room was a king suite but I found it dark and quite far from down town. Rent a car if you stay in this area. This hotel was close to sea world and is perfect for families too far from the night life for me. We had a little issue getting home with westjet and the hotel they booked us in was way better location to the things we like.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to like this place”
Reviews.Author: imadurl
Reviews.Content: I always read reviews before I travel. I saw quite a few negative reviews, but I thought I would give it a shot as the rates were excellent. I called the morning of my arrival as I was going to get in late. They didn't have the room I booked, but they quickly fixed the issue and I got the room I requested. When we arrived at 10:30 p.m. the front office staff was quick and efficient. The room, however, was a disappointment. When they call it a suite, it is not like other hotels. There was a half wall in the room separating the king bed from the bunk beds for the kids. The sink looked like it had small pieces of hair in it. I wiped it out and in the morning I heard the gurgle and sure enough it backed up and left the stubble from the last person's shave in the sink (we had a room on the bottom floor). The walls were paper thin (that is why I travel with earplugs) and you could hear everything going on outside and right next to you. One morning after I showered and opened the curtain, I called my husband because there was a bug on the floor (I don't do well with bugs) and it just happened to be a roach. It was the only one I saw - and believe me I was looking. On the plus side it was only $67 a night and there were no bed bugs. However, next time I think I will spend a bit more to get a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but.....”
Reviews.Author: chutchi
Reviews.Content: And the ammenities are good. Two rooms, two televisions and a very convenient location.. However, I stayed on the bottom floor and could hear what sounded like a frat party going on upstairs for two nights. Plus the fans in the bathrooms need replacing, and I could hear the fan from the room upstairs. So, you may want to ask for a room on the top floor. Other than that, a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not sure about the other reviewers”
Reviews.Author: roy8684
Reviews.Content: ...but I stayed at this hotel for almost two weeks and was very pleased. I highly recommend it. The room was huge (it had a bedroom and a living room) with two flat screens, fridge, microwave, pull out sofa, wardrobe, multiple dressers. The room was clean, I don't think anyone had stayed in the room before me since the remodel. Theres a hot tub and pool open year round. There's a commercial gym that offers free admission if you are staying at the hotel. You also cant beat the location with proximity to beaches/downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Older motel that is less than impressive”
Reviews.Author: terandboys
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very big disappointment. It was actually a motel in desperate need of cleaning and updating. The area offers a large verity of eating establishments, and it is close to the theme parks. On the up side, this location does accept pets. I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate if out at theme parks all day”
Reviews.Author: Stuart S
Reviews.Content: We found the room adequate as we were only here from 7pm to 9 am each day as we were at the theme parks all days it had what we wanted a bed, shower and toilet. The hotel is part of a large complex and has buildings A, B & C. It needs a renovation on mainly small items such as painting and our toilet door stuck and would not close, the front door was also hard to close. There are rust marks on hinges and edges of walls so as I said needs some basic repairs and attention. The staff at check in were friendly and they had some discount vouchers for the theme parks. It is in a good location being around a ten minute drive from SeaWorld and San Diego zoo and about a 30 minute drive to Lego land. There is also banks, supermarket and shops across the road or short walk. This best feature was the attached restaurant which had great meals and breakfast in fact the breakfast ranked in our top breakfast over our 40 days in the US. Overall it is good if you do not plan to be in the hotel too much.

Reviews.Title: “close to seaworld and local shopping complexes”
Reviews.Author: ansh0806
Reviews.Content: the room was neat and also had a small fridge to chill drinks. can't expect the ambiance to be extraordinary but its worth the money and its just opposite to Phil's BBQ which is awesome. The staff were good and accommodating..worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: Happycamper411
Reviews.Content: I was nervous before our arrival because of some of the reviews but we found the Wyndham Gardens wonderful and would totally recommend to our friends. The room was clean and so family friendly. We had a newly decorated King Bed and bunk beds. It was so nice to have our own space. The kids loved the bunk beds and the pool. There was a nice big fridge and a flat screen tv. Lots of storage for clothes and luggage. We loved the pool the kids swam every night, we were able to sit poolside and enjoy a cocktail from the bar and restaurant attached to the pool. The guests were so friendly and so were the staff. Parking was great the spots were not too small, there is lots of parking. The location is fantastic only minutes to Sea World, Zoo and beaches. You can walk to the grocery store which is right across the street and so is Starbucks. Phil's bbq is also across the street and is a fantastic place to eat. It is very popular so be prepared to stand in line to get in. Even though the hotel is close to the road we were never bothered with traffic noise. San Diego is such a beautiful place, friendly people and gorgeous beaches, we will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Sea World but that is the only benefit. I have never written a poor reveiw for a hotel but this one deserves it. Rooms are old, beds are horrible, parking is terrible. Had a Jr suite for 4 people,room had 1 washcloth and 2 towels. Room was not cleaned at 5pm when I returned to room. A/C was not working on arrival. Asked for a Handicap accessible room, didnt get it. I reccommend you look around before settling on this one.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JTraver27
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the king suite located on the second floor of one of the buildings. We came in on a Wednesday and were quite pleased with our first day/night. Once the weekend hit, the parking lot was extremely tight and it was difficult to find a spot. Overall, the room was nice. It had a small refrigerator and our room (which might be because it was a suite) was separated into a "living room space" and a "bedroom space." We slept great...no loud noises during the night, despite the hotel being located on a somewhat busy road. Besides the parking, the only other problem we had during our stay was that in the main lobby area they offer the standard hot water, coffee, tea, etc. I walked down to get some in the morning...and they were all out. The only serve during certain hours, however I was there during those hours and there was none to be found. I would have spoke with a hotel employee, but the one at the desk was dealing with an angry vacationer at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: jill t
Reviews.Content: Had heard good things about Wyndham, but after this experience I probably wouldnt stay in one again. Checked in late with our 2 year old and got to the room only to find we didnt have a crib as requested. Called front desk and was told there were none and that they didnt guarantee availability. Booked the room almost a month in advance and requested crib specifically because my daughter wont sleep otherwise, so was disappointed and didnt get any sleep first night. Also booked suite due to need for seperate area for my daughter and found that the sliding door that seperated the room was off the track and wouldnt close. Next morning realized also that neither tv worked, the door to the room didnt seal (I could see the sunlight all the way around it) and the refrigerator seal was cracked so there was water leaking onto the carpet. Went to front desk to find out about crib availability and tell them about all the issues and they said they'd get everything fixed. Front desk woman was very polite and helpful, but when we returned later the door still wouldnt close and the fridge was still the exact same. Second night we did have the crib, but at about 1am the person in the room above us walked back and forth over our heads for an hour before I called the desk to complain. Woman said she'd send security and the footsteps stopped for awhile, but started again by about 4am. When we checked out I told them how upset we were with the stay and they offered to take $20 off of our stay. $20?? Overall, very disappointed in the quality. Location is nice and Dupars restaurant was excellent, but I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: bzesunshine
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly staff, decent prices. Not a strong Wi-Fi signal in our room. The hotel is built around Du-Par's restaurant, which has really good pancakes. It also has a community pool for the guests and a nice little bar too. We were there on a Friday and Saturday and we could see the fireworks from the pool. It was nice. Also Phil's BBQ is located across the street and the baby back ribs are extremely delicious. And there is also a swap meet next to Phil's that they have every weekend. It has everything you can think of. San Diego is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: We stayed over night for a wedding reception and had a blast. the staff was really cool and I was actually surprised how nice the room was. I can definitely recommend. Breakfast at Dupars was delicious. Try the pancakes they're bomb!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Services”
Reviews.Author: susanb119
Reviews.Content: I live in NY and came to San Diego for 4 days to get my daughter settled at college. While here, my flight was cancelled because of Hurricane up North. I was informed by airline I would not be able to board another flight for 8 more days. Being a single parent, I do not have money for any unforeseen circumstances. I went to the front desk in tears and explained my situation to the Manager, Laurie Iona, and to the desk personnel, Jarrett and Brialonna. They were great.. Ms. Iona, worked with me and was able to put a roof over my head for the 8 days that I am stuck here. Not only in this a clean, and centrally located hotel, but their hospitality was ounstanding and very much appreciated..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Rebley
Reviews.Content: We booked here after a HORRIBLE experience with an Expedia unpublished rate. We had stayed here earlier this year and after our experience with the other hotel, were VERY eager to return. We called and got a same day reservation for a reasonable price. Jenna was very friendly and helpful with the whole process. We got a beautiful renovated room that didn't make us feel like we need to bath in Purell. I love that this hotel is centrally located, feels like you are minutes from everything. No complaints here and we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here! Wyndham name...that is about all!”
Reviews.Author: Karin P
Reviews.Content: This is a Motor Motel not worth the $100+ bucks. It is on Mission Bay but that is the only redeeming quality. Run down, Grimy and poor customer service. I stayed there with my 2 year old son when I took him to Sea World and when I checked in they had us in a room in a corner of one of the buildings on the ground floor. They had not bothered turning on any of the lights in the corridor and it was dark and hard to see. I ended up tripping over a step from the corridor to the parking lot since I could not see a thing! I sprained my ankle bad and could not walk. When I called the front desk for assistance she said they did not have an ace bandage or anything. The front desk Receptionist was put out and annoyed since she was helping a customer check in and told me to drive to AM PM down the street! UM Hello...Right foot sprained/possibly broken...um hello alone with a 2 year old who is sleeping in room. AND it was their fault that the lights were not on. I told her "you should really have lights on it is extremely dangerous" later that night I saw that they had the lights on...at least no one else then would trip. I ended up the next morning wrapping my foot myself with cloth and just wanted to get the hell out of there. If I was not alone with son I would have taken time to write up the report...honestly so not worth it. DON'T STAY HERE!!!! BUDGET CRAPPY HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Moldy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: StudebakerWife
Reviews.Content: Moldy filthy rooms. (I looked at 6 different rooms). Heavy mold around air conditioner...asked for it to be cleaned twice (on 2 consecutive days) before switching rooms. Non responsive staff. NOT newly renovated. Half painted ceiling, broken air conditioning, dirty ceiling, rusty towel racks, ripped wall paper, poorly repaired walls. Property is poorly maintained. Housekeeping dumps dirty water buckets in parking lot. Litter on properry is not cleaned regularly (at least not daily). I walked past the same empty bottle for 3 days straight. Pool never had towels available and lobby staff only provided towels when pushed. Only redeeming feature is the restaurant where you can get a decent meal anytime of the day. I cannot believe this is a Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent clean, comfortable hotel that is near everything--literally.”
Reviews.Author: Frankie D
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Diego during the summer of 2011. I loved my stay at this hotel because there are over three walking distance shopping centers that are filled with everything a traveler may need, a bus stop located in front of the hotel that can take you anywhere for only $5(that is to and from San Diego airport, Sea World Downtown San Diego, etc), several 24-hour gyms that are in walking distance, lots of healthy places to eat that are across the street from the hotel, very affordable rates(I paid $80 each night), and most importantly: a safe, clean comfortable nights stay. The only downside to this hotel is the wireless Internet. It is very slow. However, the hotel lobby has Internet access with printers, and there is a computer gaming shop with high speed Internet access located in the shopping center. DO NOT HESITATE TO STAY AT THIS HOTELâ€”YOU WILL LOVE IT--and book early to get an amazing rate. The hotel has just been recently renovated and looks great both inside your room and out. The location of this hotel is well worth it--everything you can possible need is a short walk away, so I suggest you use Google maps to find what you need (grocery store, shoe store, Game Stop, Dennyâ€™s, etc).

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Jen M
Reviews.Content: I booked the Wyndham Garden because we wanted to stay near Mission Beach and this was the least expensive hotel in the area. We stayed in the kids mini suite which was very comfortable and had a fridge and microwave - kids loved the bunk beds. The room did not have a safe however. I asked at the front desk and they did have a safe for guest valuables but I chose to keep my valuables with me. The lobby was very nice and the staff was helpful. Kids loved the pool and I spent lots of time in the hottub. There is no gym at the hotel but my husband was able to work out a gym nearby which he said was a fantastic martial arts studio/fitness center. There is a Vons directly across the street and a Target closeby which was very convenient. When walking from my room to the lobby at night I found it was a little dark in some areas and thought a few more lights would be nice. Overall, we enjoyed this hotel and it was a great location for many San Diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located to beaches, hwy, and activities but parking was designed by an anorexic”
Reviews.Author: uws8995
Reviews.Content: Good location when trying to get to Sea World, Ocean and Mission Beaches plus access to the 5 and 8. Signage sucks and if you miss your turn it is painful. About the Hotel...no it is a motel only in this part of San Diego but no one tells you this. We arrived late Sunday night after 8 hrs on the road. The room had ants, was loud, and beds were too soft for my liking. My wife spoke with Mgmt and we were moved across the property and upgraded to a "Suite". Didn't know that there was some major baseball tournaments so quiet was not a reality. The suite was helpful for a 4 night stay given we brought a small dog. It gave us room to spread out a bit and didn't cramp with a pet. We had a few times where we left the pet in the room in her crate so housekeeping could do their thing. Housekeeping was nice and helpful during the entire trip as was the balance of the staff. The two biggest issues I had were the ultra narrow parking spots and the lack of channels on tv when we were resting between activities. Best items were the restaurants. Next to the motel we had a 24 hr restaurant that had one of the best CFC w/eggs I have ever had! Plus the muffins were monsters in size and taste. A little pricey but quality was there. The best BBQ in San Diego is across the street at Phil's. Try the Beef Rib and Chicken combo it was awesome and cost effective. The Onion rings were the size of my fist and those were the small ones. A few minutes away in OB you have Azucar which is a bakery/coffee shop that was one of the best places we visited once we learned about it. 4 days and 3 visits if that tells you anything plus stocking up the day we left. Really close to OB and Mission with both being less than 10 minutes away with lights. Would I stay again yes I would but given the ultra soft beds, noise, and a flaky elevator I can't rate it higher than a 3. If a true Hotel is your need then stay downtown. If a convenient location is more important then this is a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE WYNDHAM GARDEN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful! Staff were great we stayed for 4 days on vacation, felt like we were at home even though we were in San Diego it felt like a lot of southern hospitality! Next time were in San Diego I know where we will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Rude, unhelpful service.”
Reviews.Author: rhiroxit
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in May of 2011, booked a reservation and received a confirmation email in May of 2011. Three days before we were supposed to check in we called to confirm our reservation and they didn't have it booked. We had an order number and everything, and yet they still claimed there was nothing they could do. The people we spoke to were rude and unhelpful. . .overall very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy with poor parking.”
Reviews.Author: D705
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not very well insulated and not well maintained. We could barely close the pocket door to the bathroom with 2 people and the faucet handle was loose. We were able to hear people walking by the room and talking. The parking spaces are small and tightly spaced. It's very difficult to park a full size truck. Not worth the price just to be close to Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the money”
Reviews.Author: lovethebeach090
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights. The location is pretty seedy, with strip clubs and homeless hanging around. But there are also plenty of grocery stores and shopping nearby too. The location, though in a rougher area, was conveniently located close to beaches and downtown. The rooms were nice and clean (and I thoroughly checked for bedbugs). They had security in the parking lot, so I felt safe. The beds were comfortable, the 2 televisions in our junior suite were nice. Although it was a junior suite, it was very small. The air conditioner was rattling, but it would stop if we giggled it. The room with the pull out sofa stayed very cool, but the room with the beds did not have its own ac unit. There was a fan in the wall between the two rooms that helped, but there was still a significant temperature difference. The newer towels were very soft, though the older ones were rough. However, it seems strange that with a room set up for 6 guests, housekeeping kept leaving only 3 towels so we had to keep asking for more. they also did not include a blanket for the pullout. My kids had their own blankets so it was ok, but they were in the coldest room and an additional blanket would have been nice. The hotel shampoo and lotion were by Bath and Body works, so they were nice. Also, we called on the 1st day to say our bath drain was clogged, but I had to call again and it was finally cleared on the 3rd day. Although there has been a lot of work put in for renovation, the sidewalks are very dirty and stained. It's like walking into a renovated kitchen with a filthy floor. Power washing or restaining the walkways would make a big difference. We tried the restaurant and bakery for pastries, and found it expensive and not very fresh. Instead, we went to Von's behind the hotel and got fresh and delicious bagels and donuts for about .75 each. I like that Wyndham bought this hotel and is working toward making this area of town better. I would stay here again for the same price, which was a lot lower than other hotels (about $105 a night through bookit)

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: PF805
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wyndham Gardens from July 19 - 21 with my 5 year old daughter. My room had BED BUGS. I actually took one off the bed and gave it to the Building Engineer in a zip lock bag. It was later confirmed to me by the management that it was a BED BUG. I was told that I would be credited for my stay and offered a free two night stay at any Wyndham. It has been over a week and my credit card has yet to be credited and I have received no document in the mail regarding an additional stay. My tip is to STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean.”
Reviews.Author: katwoo72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location 5-10 minutes from SeaWorld, Old Town, downtown San Diego, a couple of grocery stores and Target (for the families), and the beach(es). We got the Kids Suite with a king-size bed, bunk bed, refrigerator, and microwave. The room was clean, except for the bathroom faucet which was a little wonky. Also, it's located right off of Sports Arena Boulevard, which is pretty busy. Since I live in quiet suburbia, the sirens, which I only heard two times while we were there, were kind of startling for me late at night--but by no means was it terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good till you look a little closer”
Reviews.Author: Alexgoku
Reviews.Content: Just the fact that I'm writing a review is an indication that there is a problem with this hotel because I have never before found the need to review a hotel. Overall I suggest you look elsewhere to stay of you can afford it and want a quality hotel. The first day at this hotel after taking a nap I get off my bed only to have the frame collapse, leaving the bed displaced. The nicer of the 2 tvs did not work at all so it must have been just for show. The working tv had bad reception. The tiles in the bathroom were loose and the drain looked horrific. The sinks water stopper was closed and the button to raise it was missing so I had to pry it open. I had asked to move to another room after all this was noticed but they were sold out so they could only offer to send maintainace for the sink. The only pros to this place are yay they at least had a small fridge and microwave. The only reason I can imagine people stay here is they it's cheaper then the other nearby places (for a reason).

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Broken Equipment, Mgr. would not return calls.”
Reviews.Author: JoffreyLong
Reviews.Content: Thought Wyndham would be ok, usually is. At this place, icemakers were broken, on my floor, the other floor down, and in the next building. Still broken on 3rd day when I left. Hallways were dirty, paint chipped all over. Worse part, called and left message for manager on Friday morning, no call back. Called corp. office on Monday, then got a speaker phone call on Monday evening from mgr., who proceeded to talk for 10 minutes about all the improvements they were making. Bottom line: This should not be a Wyndham, and I'll never stay here again. Too many nice choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT...POOR QUALITY and ROOM BURGLARY!”
Reviews.Author: daytripper107
Reviews.Content: The front desk/management was horrible. There were cops the next day due to report that a neighboring room got burglarized! We checked in late Sunday, about close to midnight since our flight had a loooong lay over, at the front desk they still took a long time getting our reservation to come up their system. We reserved a suite for 3nights and once we got to the room, two technicians who were fixing the room even asked us what we were doing there since the room is not sleepable. We had to go back to front desk and they downgraded our rooms and said they will give us the third night complimentary plus free breakfast the next day for the inconvenience. The room had no towels nor were the beds covered with blankets. We were exhausted and ended up sharing our personal bath items since the room was incomplete with amenities. The front desk said they can't give us anything till the next day when housekeeping does laundry and carries the supplies! To sum it up, we ended up checking into another hotel on the third night since the manager promised us a complimentary night which he said he will adjust upon check out. When we did check out that day, the manager was not available and the front desk associates had nomclue what we were talking about. Up to now the manager who promised us he will send our online booking agent the adjustment so we can be reimbursed the third night still has not returned our calls. We paid for a suite but got a double room instead and did not receive the refund he promised tom give us formthe whole inconvenience and disservice. We would have been better checking in at nearby 2-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: surfer5757
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a centrally located hotel to the beach and attractions when we came across this hotel. Althought the reviews made us very cautious, to say the least, it met with all we were looking for along with the added bonus of newly renovated rooms. The staff was very friendly and knowlegable and assisted us when we requested which was quit often. Regardless of some of the reviews we enjoyed our stay and when visiting San Diego we will be stay at this hotel. Great staff, very nice rooms and clean gounds.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but Bad Communication”
Reviews.Author: berrieblonde18
Reviews.Content: My first experience was when I first called the hotel to make a reservation. The hotel representative transfered me to another line which went straight to voicemail which I thought was odd so I hung up. I called the reservation line and made a reservation with the reservation representative. I asked her about a deposit or an authorization on my credit card and she informed me that only $50.00 was going to be held as an authorization for my stay. I checked into the hotel and the staff seemed very friendly. The housekeeper who cleaned my room everyday was very nice and always gave me clean towels. It turned bad when I had checked out and drove back home to Los Angeles only to find THREE different credit card charges on my credit card statement. I called the hotel to ask why my card got charged three times for different amounts and the hotel representative said one charge was for the room and the other two charges were authorization/deposit charge. When I told the hotel rep. that I was informed that only $50.00 was going to be authorized she said that I received the wrong information and that the authorization charges would clear within a couple of days. I freaked out because of all the charges they made on my credit card without my knowledge made my bank account NEGATIVE. I couldn't believe that the representative for the reservation line gave me the wrong information. When I received the hotel survey (via email) I complained about the situation and all I received from the general manager was sorry for the inconvenience. I would only stay here again if I received in writing from the hotel that my credit card would only be charged for a specific amount otherwise I would stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: ksm3672
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Sandiego was at the tail end of a long trip to California. We stayed two nights and we were just planning to go to Seaworld and then stay at hotel and relax and go to the pool after long vacation. I specifically picked the junior suite with two double beds, it has a separate living room area with two tvs. We checked in after Sea World, I had called the hotel earlier that day and confirmed my reservation and room type. When I got there I was in line at the front desk behind a long line of people already unhappy with their rooms. After waiting for a considerable amount of time I was advised they were overbooked, they did not have my room. They gave me a kids suite with a king bed and bunk beds. My kids 19, 19 and 11. So this was not great. Once out of the lobby we soon realized there was some type of motorcycle get together going on. So there was much partying going on, outside the rooms and by the pool area so the kids could not go. In addition to that there were kids running around all over the place and knocking on the doors. The room was one room with the bunk beds and king bed separated by a small partition. The room was ok, but worn. Bathtub was stopped up. High speed internet did not work and tv only had about six channels that came in. If you travel down the street looking for a restaurant the area has lots of strip clubs. The only plus was that it is close to sea world and the airport. I complained to the manager the next day and did get a significant discount on my stay. Won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: jlintuc
Reviews.Content: BEDBUGS! Beware. This hotel is infested with bedbugs. We stayed there Jun 26-Jul 1 in room 216. We found a bug on Wed and they offered to switch rooms, but being naieve about the little critters, we stayed in the room one more night. But after some research we switched rooms to room 223, and spent the entire next day washing our clothing (at the hotels expense). After notifying them about the problem they should have had a step by step action plan on how to handle the situation, but they don't. The hotel manager just looked at us and shrugged, not really knowing what to do. We have since found them in our vehicle we drove home in, they must have been in the room we moved to, so clearly they hitched a ride. We have taken precautions so as not to get them in our home, but we will see... Needless to say the entire vacation was ruined by the ineptness of Wyndham Hotels on how to handle the situation. That being said, the front desk staff were very helpful with what limited knowledge and resources they had available to them. Brenda Graves, your response to bedbug survivor's post reveals your lack of knowledge on the subject. Unless you had a dog come in, it might be quite some time till you see evidence of an infestation. It doesn't matter if everything in the room in new. They hide in the baseboards, behind the headboard, cracks of the walls! I'm quite sure you didn't rip out the drywall...

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: ntz4golf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Garden San Diego from July 1 departing on July 8. The staff were mostly very helpful. We had a Jr King Suite. The pros- great location, close to airport, downtown, the beaches, Sea World, freeways,etc. The bed was comfortable. Excellent water pressure in shower. Construction is over. Lots of counter space for personal care products. The cons- Room was pretty small for a suite. Sink is not in the bathroom but in the bedroom. AC is in the front room only, not in BR. Had to go to housekeeping several times to get our towels. Guest computers and printers worked sporadically. Upstairs guests had small kids making noise. Would I stay here again?...I'd probably like to try somewhere else. Not a knock on the place but I'd like to find something a little bit nicer perhaps.

Reviews.Title: “Terriable service! Will try to avoid any other Wyndham branch”
Reviews.Author: hubin1
Reviews.Content: I book this hotel through Hotels.com. I am not sure if my mistake started there but here is my experience. We made a trip to San Diego to see the sea world!! We had an awesome time!!! During day around 3PM, I called the Wyndham Garden hotel to confirm my reservation. Someone in the Wyndham Garden San Diego transfer me to some reservation center which I was on hold for about 15mins. I hung and call the hotel again makes sure they have not sent me to a wrong department. This time same person was able to confirm my reservation, oddly... I also asked what the latest time that I can check in is and the answer was anytime before mid-night. This worked out great because i didn't have to leave the park during the day and come back in. WRONG!!!! About 10:30 or so when we exited the park and we head to the hotel to rest and only to find out that they do not have a room for my family... When I told them that I called in earlier and they â€œACKLNOWLEDGEâ€� that they did took my call but still donâ€™t have a room for me. Their respond was we already had to send five other families because of this issue... Front desk lady told me to call Hotels.com and they are able to fix this for me. I call the Hotels.com and there were bunch of issue where they were dropping my calls from transferring from one department to the other. On the fourth try, a representative named Beth, told me that she got it all fixed with Wyndham hotel and that they should have a room ready for us with their sisterâ€™s hotel Ramada inn. I think it was passed mid-night at this point. We drove back to the Wyndham and they said they have no room and they didnâ€™t told hotels.com anything about give me a room at the Ramada Innâ€¦ At this point, I think I reach the end of my tolerance for patience. I demand someone has to step up and give us a room to stay. I asked to call the Hotels.com together to get a resolution. We did dial but after couple mins in, she just hung up and said that â€œlet me give you this room which was reserved for someone else at the Ramada Innâ€�... I am not sure who was lying but if they reject 5 other families because of reservation issue, they need to get that fixed!!!! Either way, I am not going to book anything through Hotels.com nor stay at any other Wyndham branched/associated hotelsâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not recommended”
Reviews.Author: marymaker
Reviews.Content: The primary concern was the grounds of the hotel which were very dirty. There was litter everywhere and some of it offensive litter. There was a vagrant sleeping in one of the street hallways. There were no towels in the room upon arrival. Housekeeping did not replenish the coffee packs but just left the empty ones. The staff at the front desk did not extend simple courtesies such as thank you, we're sorry or ask if we enjoyed our stay. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “First and Last stay at a Wyndham”
Reviews.Author: Browsing4trips
Reviews.Content: This is not a Hotel, it is a Motel and the rating is not more then a 2, and that is stretching it. As per the previous review, we too found bugs in the beds of room 285 and little black spots all over sheets, son was bitten by something. Kudos for the nice lobby the employees work in, but the paying customer gets a different view. No elevator, no working ice machines, a pool for 20 people but 5 buildings with 3 floors of people. Little fridge falls over every time it is opened--missing leg. Not renovated; redecorated--- A/C is a joke--loud & freezes one room while no ventilation in other. Rooms are small with paper thin walls, exterior is dirty and smelly, no garbage cans outside. Parking lot is small, cars are too close together.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Kid's suite was nice”
Reviews.Author: jperez854
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four night around the 4th of July. We arrived early and hoped to check-in, but had to wait till the "official" check-in time of 3pm. At 3pm we were given a room around the block (seemed less safe) that was not clean. We finally got a clean room closer to pool & restaurant. We were given a voucher for free breakfast to make up for the mistake, and really enjoyed the conjoining restaurant which also had a nice poolside bar. Kids enjoyed the poll and the bunk beds in suite. The fridge and microwave in our room came in handy. The beds were comfortable as mattress appeared to be a foam one that conformed to your body's shape. Lot of stores and restaurants nearby and we used the Target and Chipotles restaurant several times. Seaworld, Mission Beach, and Ocean's Beach a short 5-10 minute drive away. Only complaint was that we often needed to call for towels, and the free WiFi was the worst ever. WiFi only worked on the last day and only in the lobby and pool area. I have an Ipad 2 and an Iphone 4 and have never had a problem with WiFi. The free tech support could not help and I gave up after 5 calls. I would have rather paid for WiFi than that useless (different company's) WiFi. All-in-all a good place to stay, if you leave your computer at home.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: bedbugsurvivor
Reviews.Content: Dear Readers, I kid you NOT, my family stayed here recently and found BED BUGS!!!!!! i had no idea what bed bugs looked like, thought the first one might be a large tick. discounted this when i saw the bug only had 6 legs. next morning felt itchy and noticed several reddish colored bugs crawling on the bed...freshly fed bed bugs!!!!! ( i googled it and positively identified them). currently my bags and clothes are locked up in the car till i can figure out for sure how to treat and eradicate all potential hitch hikers. i am absolutely DISGUSTED!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Centrally Located!!”
Reviews.Author: dtheriot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to get away and take in a ball game and do a little sightseeing. Wyndham provided us with a clean room, helpful staff and a fun time. I, especially, appreciated the bartender and her willingness to contact a local tavern to find out who was showing the local game. Marissa went out of her way to ensure we had the experience we wanted! Tip for the traveler to this Wyndham, ask for the newly renovated rooms. There were a few fellow guests we spoke with that were not too happy with their older style rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: HeidiDD
Reviews.Content: We really like the Wyndham Garden. It is the perfect location. Less than a mile from Sea World and Mission beach. Close to freeway access, and local roads. Like other reviewers have said, it isn't the best location, but it is close to many places. I was a little concerned about the fact that there were not many reviews, but they are remodeling the entire place and it is brand new. Now keep in mind it is a remodel, and not a new hotel. We liked that we didn't have to drive far to get to Sea World. We paid $90 a night for our 5 nights there, it is the least expensive place for the money!!! The bunkbeds are so NICE!!! It was nice to have each kid have their own bed and night fight over space in a queen or double. The king bed offers plenty of space. Soft mattresses, and nice comforters. The only draw back was no breakfast. With the money we saved from staying here we went out to breakfast. (they also have a microwave for oatmeal or other microwave breakfast) We did return to our room one night and found that they had only left 1 towel. We called the front desk and they brought more with in 20 minutes. It wasn't a problem for us at all and they were very nice! Parking is a little over crowded, but it was never a problem for us. The gym close by uses the parking during the day, but by night there are not many cars that are using from the gym. It is a little odd seeing guys walk accrost the parking lot, and then disappear around the building. It made me wonder the first night, but then I realized they were going to work out. Pool was ok, and the hot tub was working even though we were told it wouldn't be when we got there. Overall I really liked our stay! Good location, close to everything. Clean rooms, nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. STAFF WAS PHENOMENAL !!!”
Reviews.Author: TrvllvrNYC
Reviews.Content: there for business and pleasure. rooms are all brand new. great furnishings. modern. huge.. suite was excellent ,roomy and felt like a apartment. and CHEAP ! staff bent over backwards and couldn't be more professional. confusion because i needed a handicapped room and was advised at that time i checked in they dont have handicapped suites just rooms. this info. should be displayed on their and third party sites. would not have booked if i knew this in advance. but so glad i decided to stay. placed was booked solid and was a bit overwhelming. huge property. not a resort. in a very commercial area. everything close and dozens of restaurants, fast food etc. 1 major problem. Internet did not work for the entire week. staff tried everyday to help. tech support also. could not fix it. this ruined my trip and i could not work there. but was not the staffs fault. dont buy the deal with the breakfast included. save your money. it only includes 3 choices-, 2 pancakes, 2 eggs or an omelet. if you had to pay for it would cost $6,00. learned important lesson. DONT book through third party sight.- expedia, hotel,com etc. you have no rights. hotel and airline tells you to complain to them. they tell you they cant do anything. your not saving anything WILL GO BACK TO THIS HOTEL ANY TIME IN SAN DIEGO. i honestly felt as if needed i could live at this hotel suite Hopefully their Internet will work. Miss the entire staff..

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Not Recommend this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mohammed32655
Reviews.Content: This is a motel rather than a hotel. The lobby was updated, but the quality of the rooms is not very good. You can do much better with for the same price range in this area. Didn't feel my car was safe in the parking lot overnight. The management was rude and not interested in my concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: kmSENSEI
Reviews.Content: The customer service was great. Parking spaces are too small. I could barely fit my Silverado in a space. Free WiFi & breakfast was included. Breakfast was at a restaurant called "Dupar's" and we chose the 2 egg breakfast. It was quite filling. our server was awesome. Overall great value, definite concert goer stay, close walking distance to Sports Arena & everything else!

Reviews.Title: “Reservations do not mean anything to the front desk employees at mission plaza hotel and suites”
Reviews.Author: kjh1999us
Reviews.Content: Missed a connecting flight to san Diego, so I immediately contacted the hotel letting them know that we would be arriving later, we booked the room as a packaged deal with Expedia.com. they told me that since the room was already paid for I could check in at anytime. When I arrive at 9am I was told that our room was given away, and the next available room would not be ready until after 3pm. The cleanliness of the property is sub par, though the lobby does look nice. The staff was disinterested in my concerns, and borderline rude. I will be letting wyndham know that this location is definitely not indicative of what I envisioned that brand to be.

HotelInfo.Name: Wyndham Garden San Diego near SeaWorld
HotelInfo.Address: 3737 Sports Arena Boulevard, San Diego, CA 92110 (Formerly Mission Plaza Hotel & Suites)
